title: Piqué was publicly mocked by a car full of women ; Shakira diss track was blasting in the background [ VIDEO ]
body_text:
The saga between Gerard Piqué and Shakira continues to ripple through pop culture, even long after their highly publicized breakup. This time, the drama resurfaced in an unexpected place: the streets of Ceuta. A viral video now circulating across social media shows the former FC Barcelona star being publicly mocked with Shakira’s iconic Bizarrap Music Sessions Vol. 53, a song many fans still view as a lyrical roast of her ex.
The clip has reignited interest in one of the most talked-about celebrity breakups of the last decade, reminding everyone that when music, fame, and unresolved emotions collide, the internet never forgets.
Viral Video Sparks New Wave of Gerard Piqué and Shakira Buzz
In the video, Gerard Piqué is seen walking through Ceuta with a small group of friends, keeping a low profile. That quiet moment was interrupted when a car carrying several young women stopped nearby. Once they realized who he was, they turned up Bizarrap’s Session 53 featuring Shakira at full volume and began singing along.
The song, packed with pointed lyrics and cultural references, has become a global anthem of post-breakup empowerment. Hearing it blasted directly at Piqué in public instantly turned the moment into a real-life pop culture scene. Phones came out, laughter followed, and within minutes, the video was on its way to viral status.
Social media users quickly shared the clip across TikTok, X, and Instagram, with many calling it both awkward and surreal. Celebrity encounters rarely feel this cinematic, but this one checked every box.
Gerard Piqué’s Reaction Shows a Different Side of the Story
What made the scene even more compelling was Gerard Piqué’s reaction. Or rather, his lack of one. Instead of confronting the group or acknowledging the taunts, he kept walking. His head was slightly lowered, his hood pulled up, and his expression suggested he wanted to disappear into the background.
His friends looked on, clearly aware of what was happening, but nobody stepped in. The former footballer chose silence, letting the moment pass without escalation. For many observers, that calm response said more than any words could.
Why Shakira’s Bizarrap Session 53 Still Hits So Hard
Bizarrap Music Sessions Vol. 53 with Shakira is not just another hit song. It became a cultural phenomenon when it dropped in early 2023, breaking streaming records and dominating global charts. The track blends catchy beats with lyrics that many interpreted as a direct message to Gerard Piqué and his new relationship.
The song’s success turned Shakira into a symbol of resilience after heartbreak, and it gave fans a soundtrack for reclaiming confidence. Every time it plays, it carries the weight of that story. That is why hearing it used in a public prank against Piqué feels so loaded.
The Backstory That Keeps This Drama Alive
Shakira and Gerard Piqué announced their separation in June 2022 after more than ten years together and two children. Their relationship had once been seen as one of the most glamorous in sports and music. When news broke that Piqué had moved on with Clara Chía, public opinion quickly turned harsh.
Speculation, rumors, and emotional reactions flooded social media. Shakira’s music became her outlet, and Bizarrap Session 53 was the most explosive result of that creative release. It allowed her to tell her side of the story in a way only a global pop star can.
